sub_title: Assistant Professor and Research Team Leader at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)
summary: Research interests: archaeology of the The Netherlands, particularly the Dutch River Area, Late Iron Age, Roman period, Early Middle Ages, rural communities, burial ritual, human mobility (migration and trade), material culture studies.

awards: [{'title': 'PAN wins Dutch Data Prize 2018 !', 'description': 'The Dutch Data Prize is awarded to datasets with innovative approaches in structuring and presenting scientific data and for making these available for re-use. The 2018 prize for Humaniora / Social Sciences was awarded to Portable Antiquities of the Netherlands (PAN). The judges value the way the data is structured: PAN connects individual finds to reference types - standardized scientific descriptions of artefacts. The finds can be used for research and the reference types may serve all archaeologists for other purposes as well. Furthermore the way PAN delivers the DATA to DANS for re-use and availability for several European data services is appreciated. Thirdly the citizen science aspect of PAN was mentioned: PAN works with volunteer archaeologists, mainly members of the public using a metal detector as a leisure activity, and including their finds in this innovative infrastructure was highly valued.', 'issuer': 'Research Data Netherlands (RDNL)', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, {'title': 'W.A. van Es prize', 'description': 'The W.A. van Es prize is a young talent award annually rewarded to archaeologists. In a two or three year cycle, student graduation theses, doctoral theses and other professional publications are evaluated. In 2011, Stijn received the W.A. van Es prize for the best PhD-thesis in archaeology in the years 2009-2010-2011.', 'issuer': 'National Heritage Agency of the Netherlands', 'date': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}]
